00001 /* stbi-1.09 - public domain JPEG/PNG reader - http://nothings.org/stb_image.c
00002                       when you control the images you're loading
00003 
00004    QUICK NOTES:
00005       Primarily of interest to game developers and other people who can
00006           avoid problematic images and only need the trivial interface
00007 
00008       JPEG baseline (no JPEG progressive, no oddball channel decimations)
00009       PNG non-interlaced
00010       BMP non-1bpp, non-RLE
00011       TGA (not sure what subset, if a subset)
00012       PSD (composited view only, no extra channels)
00013       HDR (radiance rgbE format)
00014       writes BMP,TGA (define STBI_NO_WRITE to remove code)
00015       decoded from memory or through stdio FILE (define STBI_NO_STDIO to remove code)
00016         
00017    TODO:
00018       stbi_info_*
00019   
00020    history:
00021       1.09   Fix format-conversion for PSD code (bad global variables!)
00022       1.08   Thatcher Ulrich's PSD code integrated by Nicolas Schulz
00023       1.07   attempt to fix C++ warning/errors again
00024       1.06   attempt to fix C++ warning/errors again
00025       1.05   fix TGA loading to return correct *comp and use good luminance calc
00026       1.04   default float alpha is 1, not 255; use 'void *' for stbi_image_free
00027       1.03   bugfixes to STBI_NO_STDIO, STBI_NO_HDR
00028       1.02   support for (subset of) HDR files, float interface for preferred access to them
00029       1.01   fix bug: possible bug in handling right-side up bmps... not sure
00030              fix bug: the stbi_bmp_load() and stbi_tga_load() functions didn't work at all
00031       1.00   interface to zlib that skips zlib header
00032       0.99   correct handling of alpha in palette
00033       0.98   TGA loader by lonesock; dynamically add loaders (untested)
00034       0.97   jpeg errors on too large a file; also catch another malloc failure
00035       0.96   fix detection of invalid v value - particleman@mollyrocket forum
00036       0.95   during header scan, seek to markers in case of padding
00037       0.94   STBI_NO_STDIO to disable stdio usage; rename all #defines the same
00038       0.93   handle jpegtran output; verbose errors
00039       0.92   read 4,8,16,24,32-bit BMP files of several formats
00040       0.91   output 24-bit Windows 3.0 BMP files
00041       0.90   fix a few more warnings; bump version number to approach 1.0
00042       0.61   bugfixes due to Marc LeBlanc, Christopher Lloyd
00043       0.60   fix compiling as c++
00044       0.59   fix warnings: merge Dave Moore's -Wall fixes
00045       0.58   fix bug: zlib uncompressed mode len/nlen was wrong endian
00046       0.57   fix bug: jpg last huffman symbol before marker was >9 bits but less
00047                       than 16 available
00048       0.56   fix bug: zlib uncompressed mode len vs. nlen
00049       0.55   fix bug: restart_interval not initialized to 0
00050       0.54   allow NULL for 'int *comp'
00051       0.53   fix bug in png 3->4; speedup png decoding
00052       0.52   png handles req_comp=3,4 directly; minor cleanup; jpeg comments
00053       0.51   obey req_comp requests, 1-component jpegs return as 1-component,
00054              on 'test' only check type, not whether we support this variant
00055 */

00057 
00059 //
00060 // Limitations:
00061 //    - no progressive/interlaced support (jpeg, png)
00062 //    - 8-bit samples only (jpeg, png)
00063 //    - not threadsafe
00064 //    - channel subsampling of at most 2 in each dimension (jpeg)
00065 //    - no delayed line count (jpeg) -- IJG doesn't support either
00066 //
00067 // Basic usage (see HDR discussion below):
00068 //    int x,y,n;
00069 //    unsigned char *data = stbi_load(filename, &x, &y, &n, 0);
00070 //    // ... process data if not NULL ... 
00071 //    // ... x = width, y = height, n = # 8-bit components per pixel ...
00072 //    // ... replace '0' with '1'..'4' to force that many components per pixel
00073 //    stbi_image_free(data)
00074 //
00075 // Standard parameters:
00076 //    int *x       -- outputs image width in pixels
00077 //    int *y       -- outputs image height in pixels
00078 //    int *comp    -- outputs # of image components in image file
00079 //    int req_comp -- if non-zero, # of image components requested in result
00080 //
00081 // The return value from an image loader is an 'unsigned char *' which points
00082 // to the pixel data. The pixel data consists of *y scanlines of *x pixels,
00083 // with each pixel consisting of N interleaved 8-bit components; the first
00084 // pixel pointed to is top-left-most in the image. There is no padding between
00085 // image scanlines or between pixels, regardless of format. The number of
00086 // components N is 'req_comp' if req_comp is non-zero, or *comp otherwise.
00087 // If req_comp is non-zero, *comp has the number of components that _would_
00088 // have been output otherwise. E.g. if you set req_comp to 4, you will always
00089 // get RGBA output, but you can check *comp to easily see if it's opaque.
00090 //
00091 // An output image with N components has the following components interleaved
00092 // in this order in each pixel:
00093 //
00094 //     N=#comp     components
00095 //       1           grey
00096 //       2           grey, alpha
00097 //       3           red, green, blue
00098 //       4           red, green, blue, alpha
00099 //
00100 // If image loading fails for any reason, the return value will be NULL,
00101 // and *x, *y, *comp will be unchanged. The function stbi_failure_reason()
00102 // can be queried for an extremely brief, end-user unfriendly explanation
00103 // of why the load failed. Define STBI_NO_FAILURE_STRINGS to avoid
00104 // compiling these strings at all, and STBI_FAILURE_USERMSG to get slightly
00105 // more user-friendly ones.
00106 //
00107 // Paletted PNG and BMP images are automatically depalettized.
00108 //
00109 //
00110 // ===========================================================================
00111 //
00112 // HDR image support   (disable by defining STBI_NO_HDR)
00113 //
00114 // stb_image now supports loading HDR images in general, and currently
00115 // the Radiance .HDR file format, although the support is provided
00116 // generically. You can still load any file through the existing interface;
00117 // if you attempt to load an HDR file, it will be automatically remapped to
00118 // LDR, assuming gamma 2.2 and an arbitrary scale factor defaulting to 1;
00119 // both of these constants can be reconfigured through this interface:
00120 //
00121 //     stbi_hdr_to_ldr_gamma(2.2f);
00122 //     stbi_hdr_to_ldr_scale(1.0f);
00123 //
00124 // (note, do not use _inverse_ constants; stbi_image will invert them
00125 // appropriately).
00126 //
00127 // Additionally, there is a new, parallel interface for loading files as
00128 // (linear) floats to preserve the full dynamic range:
00129 //
00130 //    float *data = stbi_loadf(filename, &x, &y, &n, 0);
00131 // 
00132 // If you load LDR images through this interface, those images will
00133 // be promoted to floating point values, run through the inverse of
00134 // constants corresponding to the above:
00135 //
00136 //     stbi_ldr_to_hdr_scale(1.0f);
00137 //     stbi_ldr_to_hdr_gamma(2.2f);
00138 //
00139 // Finally, given a filename (or an open file or memory block--see header
00140 // file for details) containing image data, you can query for the "most
00141 // appropriate" interface to use (that is, whether the image is HDR or
00142 // not), using:
00143 //
00144 //     stbi_is_hdr(char *filename);
00145 
00146

00163    STBI_rgb_alpha  = 4,
00164 };

00304 // define new loaders
00305 typedef struct
00306 {
00307    int       (*test_memory)(stbi_uc *buffer, int len);
00308    stbi_uc * (*load_from_memory)(stbi_uc *buffer, int len, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp);
00309    #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00310    int       (*test_file)(FILE *f);
00311    stbi_uc * (*load_from_file)(FILE *f, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp);
00312    #endif
00313 } stbi_loader;

00361 char *stbi_failure_reason(void)
00362 {

00365 
00366 static int e(char *str)
00367 {
00368    failure_reason = str;
00369    return 0;
00370 }
00371 
00372 #ifdef STBI_NO_FAILURE_STRINGS
00373    #define e(x,y)  0
00374 #elif defined(STBI_FAILURE_USERMSG)
00375    #define e(x,y)  e(y)
00376 #else
00377    #define e(x,y)  e(x)
00378 #endif
00379 
00380 #define epf(x,y)   ((float *) (e(x,y)?NULL:NULL))
00381 #define epuc(x,y)  ((unsigned char *) (e(x,y)?NULL:NULL))

00387 
00388 #define MAX_LOADERS  32
00389 stbi_loader *loaders[MAX_LOADERS];
00390 static int max_loaders = 0;
00391 
00392 int stbi_register_loader(stbi_loader *loader)
00393 {
00394    int i;
00395    for (i=0; i < MAX_LOADERS; ++i) {
00396       // already present?
00397       if (loaders[i] == loader)
00398          return 1;
00399       // end of the list?
00400       if (loaders[i] == NULL) {
00401          loaders[i] = loader;
00402          max_loaders = i+1;
00403          return 1;
00404       }
00405    }
00406    // no room for it
00407    return 0;
00408 }

00410 #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00411 static float   *ldr_to_hdr(stbi_uc *data, int x, int y, int comp);
00412 static stbi_uc *hdr_to_ldr(float   *data, int x, int y, int comp);
00413 #endif

00415 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00416 unsigned char *stbi_load(char *filename, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00417 {
00418    FILE *f = fopen(filename, "rb");
00419    unsigned char *result;
00420    if (!f) return epuc("can't fopen", "Unable to open file");
00421    result = stbi_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00422    fclose(f);
00423    return result;
00424 }
00425 
00426 unsigned char *stbi_load_from_file(FILE *f, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00427 {
00428    int i;
00429    if (stbi_jpeg_test_file(f))
00430       return stbi_jpeg_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00431    if (stbi_png_test_file(f))
00432       return stbi_png_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00433    if (stbi_bmp_test_file(f))
00434       return stbi_bmp_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00435    if (stbi_psd_test_file(f))
00436       return stbi_psd_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00437    #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00438    if (stbi_hdr_test_file(f)) {
00439       float *hdr = stbi_hdr_load_from_file(f, x,y,comp,req_comp);
00440       return hdr_to_ldr(hdr, *x, *y, req_comp ? req_comp : *comp);
00441    }
00442    #endif
00443    for (i=0; i < max_loaders; ++i)
00444       if (loaders[i]->test_file(f))
00445          return loaders[i]->load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00446    // test tga last because it's a crappy test!
00447    if (stbi_tga_test_file(f))
00448       return stbi_tga_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00449    return epuc("unknown image type", "Image not of any known type, or corrupt");
00450 }
00451 #endif
00452 
00453 unsigned char *stbi_load_from_memory(stbi_uc *buffer, int len, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00454 {
00455    int i;
00456    if (stbi_jpeg_test_memory(buffer,len))
00457       return stbi_jpeg_load_from_memory(buffer,len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00458    if (stbi_png_test_memory(buffer,len))
00459       return stbi_png_load_from_memory(buffer,len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00460    if (stbi_bmp_test_memory(buffer,len))
00461       return stbi_bmp_load_from_memory(buffer,len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00462    if (stbi_psd_test_memory(buffer,len))
00463       return stbi_psd_load_from_memory(buffer,len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00464    #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00465    if (stbi_hdr_test_memory(buffer, len)) {
00466       float *hdr = stbi_hdr_load_from_memory(buffer, len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00467       return hdr_to_ldr(hdr, *x, *y, req_comp ? req_comp : *comp);
00468    }
00469    #endif
00470    for (i=0; i < max_loaders; ++i)
00471       if (loaders[i]->test_memory(buffer,len))
00472          return loaders[i]->load_from_memory(buffer,len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00473    // test tga last because it's a crappy test!
00474    if (stbi_tga_test_memory(buffer,len))
00475       return stbi_tga_load_from_memory(buffer,len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00476    return epuc("unknown image type", "Image not of any known type, or corrupt");
00477 }

00481 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00482 float *stbi_loadf(char *filename, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00483 {
00484    FILE *f = fopen(filename, "rb");
00485    float *result;
00486    if (!f) return epf("can't fopen", "Unable to open file");
00487    result = stbi_loadf_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00488    fclose(f);
00489    return result;
00490 }
00491 
00492 float *stbi_loadf_from_file(FILE *f, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00493 {
00494    unsigned char *data;
00495    #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00496    if (stbi_hdr_test_file(f))
00497       return stbi_hdr_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00498    #endif
00499    data = stbi_load_from_file(f, x, y, comp, req_comp);
00500    if (data)
00501       return ldr_to_hdr(data, *x, *y, req_comp ? req_comp : *comp);
00502    return epf("unknown image type", "Image not of any known type, or corrupt");
00503 }
00504 #endif
00505 
00506 float *stbi_loadf_from_memory(stbi_uc *buffer, int len, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00507 {
00508    stbi_uc *data;
00509    #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00510    if (stbi_hdr_test_memory(buffer, len))
00511       return stbi_hdr_load_from_memory(buffer, len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00512    #endif
00513    data = stbi_load_from_memory(buffer, len, x, y, comp, req_comp);
00514    if (data)
00515       return ldr_to_hdr(data, *x, *y, req_comp ? req_comp : *comp);
00516    return epf("unknown image type", "Image not of any known type, or corrupt");
00517 }
00518 #endif
00519 
00520 // these is-hdr-or-not is defined independent of whether STBI_NO_HDR is
00521 // defined, for API simplicity; if STBI_NO_HDR is defined, it always
00522 // reports false!
00523 
00524 extern int      stbi_is_hdr_from_memory(stbi_uc *buffer, int len)
00525 {
00526    #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00527    return stbi_hdr_test_memory(buffer, len);
00528    #else
00529    return 0;
00530    #endif
00531 }
00532

00535 {
00536    FILE *f = fopen(filename, "rb");
00537    int result=0;
00538    if (f) {
00539       result = stbi_is_hdr_from_file(f);
00540       fclose(f);
00541    }
00542    return result;
00543 }

00546 {

00549    #else
00550    return 0;
00551    #endif
00552 }

00557 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO

00563 #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00564 static float h2l_gamma_i=1.0f/2.2f, h2l_scale_i=1.0f;
00565 static float l2h_gamma=2.2f, l2h_scale=1.0f;
00566 
00567 void   stbi_hdr_to_ldr_gamma(float gamma) { h2l_gamma_i = 1/gamma; }
00568 void   stbi_hdr_to_ldr_scale(float scale) { h2l_scale_i = 1/scale; }
00569 
00570 void   stbi_ldr_to_hdr_gamma(float gamma) { l2h_gamma = gamma; }
00571 void   stbi_ldr_to_hdr_scale(float scale) { l2h_scale = scale; }
00572 #endif

00574 
00576 //
00577 // Common code used by all image loaders
00578 //
00579 
00580 // image width, height, # components
00581 static uint32 img_x, img_y;
00582 static int img_n, img_out_n;
00583 
00584 enum
00585 {
00586    SCAN_load=0,
00587    SCAN_type,
00588    SCAN_header,
00589 };
00590 
00591 // An API for reading either from memory or file.
00592 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00593 static FILE  *img_file;
00594 #endif
00595 static uint8 *img_buffer, *img_buffer_end;
00596 
00597 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00598 static void start_file(FILE *f)
00599 {
00600    img_file = f;
00601 }
00602 #endif
00603 
00604 static void start_mem(uint8 *buffer, int len)
00605 {
00606 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00607    img_file = NULL;
00608 #endif
00609    img_buffer = buffer;
00610    img_buffer_end = buffer+len;
00611 }
00612 
00613 static int get8(void)
00614 {
00615 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00616    if (img_file) {
00617       int c = fgetc(img_file);
00618       return c == EOF ? 0 : c;
00619    }
00620 #endif
00621    if (img_buffer < img_buffer_end)
00622       return *img_buffer++;
00623    return 0;
00624 }
00625 
00626 static int at_eof(void)
00627 {
00628 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00629    if (img_file)
00630       return feof(img_file);
00631 #endif
00632    return img_buffer >= img_buffer_end;   
00633 }
00634 
00635 static uint8 get8u(void)
00636 {
00637    return (uint8) get8();
00638 }
00639 
00640 static void skip(int n)
00641 {
00642 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00643    if (img_file)
00644       fseek(img_file, n, SEEK_CUR);
00645    else
00646 #endif
00647       img_buffer += n;
00648 }
00649 
00650 static int get16(void)
00651 {
00652    int z = get8();
00653    return (z << 8) + get8();
00654 }
00655 
00656 static uint32 get32(void)
00657 {
00658    uint32 z = get16();
00659    return (z << 16) + get16();
00660 }
00661 
00662 static int get16le(void)
00663 {
00664    int z = get8();
00665    return z + (get8() << 8);
00666 }
00667 
00668 static uint32 get32le(void)
00669 {
00670    uint32 z = get16le();
00671    return z + (get16le() << 16);
00672 }
00673 
00674 static void getn(stbi_uc *buffer, int n)
00675 {
00676 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00677    if (img_file) {
00678       fread(buffer, 1, n, img_file);
00679       return;
00680    }
00681 #endif
00682    memcpy(buffer, img_buffer, n);
00683    img_buffer += n;
00684 }
00685 
00687 //
00688 //  generic converter from built-in img_n to req_comp
00689 //    individual types do this automatically as much as possible (e.g. jpeg
00690 //    does all cases internally since it needs to colorspace convert anyway,
00691 //    and it never has alpha, so very few cases ). png can automatically
00692 //    interleave an alpha=255 channel, but falls back to this for other cases
00693 //
00694 //  assume data buffer is malloced, so malloc a new one and free that one
00695 //  only failure mode is malloc failing
00696 
00697 static uint8 compute_y(int r, int g, int b)
00698 {
00699    return (uint8) (((r*77) + (g*150) +  (29*b)) >> 8);
00700 }
00701 
00702 static unsigned char *convert_format(unsigned char *data, int img_n, int req_comp)
00703 {
00704    uint i,j;
00705    unsigned char *good;
00706 
00707    if (req_comp == img_n) return data;
00708    assert(req_comp >= 1 && req_comp <= 4);
00709 
00710    good = (unsigned char *) malloc(req_comp * img_x * img_y);
00711    if (good == NULL) {
00712       free(data);
00713       return epuc("outofmem", "Out of memory");
00714    }
00715 
00716    for (j=0; j < img_y; ++j) {
00717       unsigned char *src  = data + j * img_x * img_n   ;
00718       unsigned char *dest = good + j * img_x * req_comp;
00719 
00720       #define COMBO(a,b)  ((a)*8+(b))
00721       #define CASE(a,b)   case COMBO(a,b): for(i=0; i < img_x; ++i, src += a, dest += b)
00722 
00723       // convert source image with img_n components to one with req_comp components;
00724       // avoid switch per pixel, so use switch per scanline and massive macros
00725       switch(COMBO(img_n, req_comp)) {
00726          CASE(1,2) dest[0]=src[0], dest[1]=255; break;
00727          CASE(1,3) dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0]; break;
00728          CASE(1,4) dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0], dest[3]=255; break;
00729          CASE(2,1) dest[0]=src[0]; break;
00730          CASE(2,3) dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0]; break;
00731          CASE(2,4) dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0], dest[3]=src[1]; break;
00732          CASE(3,4) dest[0]=src[0],dest[1]=src[1],dest[2]=src[2],dest[3]=255; break;
00733          CASE(3,1) dest[0]=compute_y(src[0],src[1],src[2]); break;
00734          CASE(3,2) dest[0]=compute_y(src[0],src[1],src[2]), dest[1] = 255; break;
00735          CASE(4,1) dest[0]=compute_y(src[0],src[1],src[2]); break;
00736          CASE(4,2) dest[0]=compute_y(src[0],src[1],src[2]), dest[1] = src[3]; break;
00737          CASE(4,3) dest[0]=src[0],dest[1]=src[1],dest[2]=src[2]; break;
00738          default: assert(0);
00739       }
00740       #undef CASE
00741    }
00742 
00743    free(data);
00744    img_out_n = req_comp;
00745    return good;
00746 }
00747 
00748 #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00749 static float   *ldr_to_hdr(stbi_uc *data, int x, int y, int comp)
00750 {
00751    int i,k,n;
00752    float *output = (float *) malloc(x * y * comp * sizeof(float));
00753    if (output == NULL) { free(data); return epf("outofmem", "Out of memory"); }
00754    // compute number of non-alpha components
00755    if (comp & 1) n = comp; else n = comp-1;
00756    for (i=0; i < x*y; ++i) {
00757       for (k=0; k < n; ++k) {
00758          output[i*comp + k] = (float) pow(data[i*comp+k]/255.0f, l2h_gamma) * l2h_scale;
00759       }
00760       if (k < comp) output[i*comp + k] = data[i*comp+k]/255.0f;
00761    }
00762    free(data);
00763    return output;
00764 }
00765 
00766 #define float2int(x)   ((int) (x))
00767 static stbi_uc *hdr_to_ldr(float   *data, int x, int y, int comp)
00768 {
00769    int i,k,n;
00770    stbi_uc *output = (stbi_uc *) malloc(x * y * comp);
00771    if (output == NULL) { free(data); return epuc("outofmem", "Out of memory"); }
00772    // compute number of non-alpha components
00773    if (comp & 1) n = comp; else n = comp-1;
00774    for (i=0; i < x*y; ++i) {
00775       for (k=0; k < n; ++k) {
00776          float z = (float) pow(data[i*comp+k]*h2l_scale_i, h2l_gamma_i) * 255 + 0.5f;
00777          if (z < 0) z = 0;
00778          if (z > 255) z = 255;
00779          output[i*comp + k] = float2int(z);
00780       }
00781       if (k < comp) {
00782          float z = data[i*comp+k] * 255 + 0.5f;
00783          if (z < 0) z = 0;
00784          if (z > 255) z = 255;
00785          output[i*comp + k] = float2int(z);
00786       }
00787    }
00788    free(data);
00789    return output;
00790 }
00791 #endif
00792 
00794 //
00795 //  "baseline" JPEG/JFIF decoder (not actually fully baseline implementation)
00796 //
00797 //    simple implementation
00798 //      - channel subsampling of at most 2 in each dimension
00799 //      - doesn't support delayed output of y-dimension
00800 //      - simple interface (only one output format: 8-bit interleaved RGB)
00801 //      - doesn't try to recover corrupt jpegs
00802 //      - doesn't allow partial loading, loading multiple at once
00803 //      - still fast on x86 (copying globals into locals doesn't help x86)
00804 //      - allocates lots of intermediate memory (full size of all components)
00805 //        - non-interleaved case requires this anyway
00806 //        - allows good upsampling (see next)
00807 //    high-quality
00808 //      - upsampled channels are bilinearly interpolated, even across blocks
00809 //      - quality integer IDCT derived from IJG's 'slow'
00810 //    performance
00811 //      - fast huffman; reasonable integer IDCT
00812 //      - uses a lot of intermediate memory, could cache poorly
00813 //      - load http://nothings.org/remote/anemones.jpg 3 times on 2.8Ghz P4
00814 //          stb_jpeg:   1.34 seconds (MSVC6, default release build)
00815 //          stb_jpeg:   1.06 seconds (MSVC6, processor = Pentium Pro)
00816 //          IJL11.dll:  1.08 seconds (compiled by intel)
00817 //          IJG 1998:   0.98 seconds (MSVC6, makefile provided by IJG)
00818 //          IJG 1998:   0.95 seconds (MSVC6, makefile + proc=PPro)
00819 
00820 int stbi_jpeg_dc_only;
00821 
00822 // huffman decoding acceleration
00823 #define FAST_BITS   9  // larger handles more cases; smaller stomps less cache
00824 
00825 typedef struct
00826 {
00827    uint8  fast[1 << FAST_BITS];
00828    // weirdly, repacking this into AoS is a 10% speed loss, instead of a win
00829    uint16 code[256];
00830    uint8  values[256];
00831    uint8  size[257];
00832    unsigned int maxcode[18];
00833    int    delta[17];   // old 'firstsymbol' - old 'firstcode'
00834 } huffman;
00835 
00836 static huffman huff_dc[4];  // baseline is 2 tables, extended is 4
00837 static huffman huff_ac[4];
00838 static uint8 dequant[4][64];
00839 
00840 static int build_huffman(huffman *h, int *count)
00841 {
00842    int i,j,k=0,code;
00843    // build size list for each symbol (from JPEG spec)
00844    for (i=0; i < 16; ++i)
00845       for (j=0; j < count[i]; ++j)
00846          h->size[k++] = (uint8) (i+1);
00847    h->size[k] = 0;
00848 
00849    // compute actual symbols (from jpeg spec)
00850    code = 0;
00851    k = 0;
00852    for(j=1; j <= 16; ++j) {
00853       // compute delta to add to code to compute symbol id
00854       h->delta[j] = k - code;
00855       if (h->size[k] == j) {
00856          while (h->size[k] == j)
00857             h->code[k++] = (uint16) (code++);
00858          if (code-1 >= (1 << j)) return e("bad code lengths","Corrupt JPEG");
00859       }
00860       // compute largest code + 1 for this size, preshifted as needed later
00861       h->maxcode[j] = code << (16-j);
00862       code <<= 1;
00863    }
00864    h->maxcode[j] = 0xffffffff;
00865 
00866    // build non-spec acceleration table; 255 is flag for not-accelerated
00867    memset(h->fast, 255, 1 << FAST_BITS);
00868    for (i=0; i < k; ++i) {
00869       int s = h->size[i];
00870       if (s <= FAST_BITS) {
00871          int c = h->code[i] << (FAST_BITS-s);
00872          int m = 1 << (FAST_BITS-s);
00873          for (j=0; j < m; ++j) {
00874             h->fast[c+j] = (uint8) i;
00875          }
00876       }
00877    }
00878    return 1;
00879 }
00880 
00881 // sizes for components, interleaved MCUs
00882 static int img_h_max, img_v_max;
00883 static int img_mcu_x, img_mcu_y;
00884 static int img_mcu_w, img_mcu_h;
00885 
00886 // definition of jpeg image component
00887 static struct
00888 {
00889    int id;
00890    int h,v;
00891    int tq;
00892    int hd,ha;
00893    int dc_pred;
00894 
00895    int x,y,w2,h2;
00896    uint8 *data;
00897 } img_comp[4];
00898 
00899 static unsigned long  code_buffer; // jpeg entropy-coded buffer
00900 static int            code_bits;   // number of valid bits
00901 static unsigned char  marker;      // marker seen while filling entropy buffer
00902 static int            nomore;      // flag if we saw a marker so must stop
00903  
00904 static void grow_buffer_unsafe(void)
00905 {
00906    do {
00907       int b = nomore ? 0 : get8();
00908       if (b == 0xff) {
00909          int c = get8();
00910          if (c != 0) {
00911             marker = (unsigned char) c;
00912             nomore = 1;
00913             return;
00914          }
00915       }
00916       code_buffer = (code_buffer << 8) | b;
00917       code_bits += 8;
00918    } while (code_bits <= 24);
00919 }
00920 
00921 // (1 << n) - 1
00922 static unsigned long bmask[17]={0,1,3,7,15,31,63,127,255,511,1023,2047,4095,8191,16383,32767,65535};
00923 
00924 // decode a jpeg huffman value from the bitstream
00925 __forceinline static int decode(huffman *h)
00926 {
00927    unsigned int temp;
00928    int c,k;
00929 
00930    if (code_bits < 16) grow_buffer_unsafe();
00931 
00932    // look at the top FAST_BITS and determine what symbol ID it is,
00933    // if the code is <= FAST_BITS
00934    c = (code_buffer >> (code_bits - FAST_BITS)) & ((1 << FAST_BITS)-1);
00935    k = h->fast[c];
00936    if (k < 255) {
00937       if (h->size[k] > code_bits)
00938          return -1;
00939       code_bits -= h->size[k];
00940       return h->values[k];
00941    }
00942 
00943    // naive test is to shift the code_buffer down so k bits are
00944    // valid, then test against maxcode. To speed this up, we've
00945    // preshifted maxcode left so that it has (16-k) 0s at the
00946    // end; in other words, regardless of the number of bits, it
00947    // wants to be compared against something shifted to have 16;
00948    // that way we don't need to shift inside the loop.
00949    if (code_bits < 16)
00950       temp = (code_buffer << (16 - code_bits)) & 0xffff;
00951    else
00952       temp = (code_buffer >> (code_bits - 16)) & 0xffff;
00953    for (k=FAST_BITS+1 ; ; ++k)
00954       if (temp < h->maxcode[k])
00955          break;
00956    if (k == 17) {
00957       // error! code not found
00958       code_bits -= 16;
00959       return -1;
00960    }
00961 
00962    if (k > code_bits)
00963       return -1;
00964 
00965    // convert the huffman code to the symbol id
00966    c = ((code_buffer >> (code_bits - k)) & bmask[k]) + h->delta[k];
00967    assert((((code_buffer) >> (code_bits - h->size[c])) & bmask[h->size[c]]) == h->code[c]);
00968 
00969    // convert the id to a symbol
00970    code_bits -= k;
00971    return h->values[c];
00972 }
00973 
00974 // combined JPEG 'receive' and JPEG 'extend', since baseline
00975 // always extends everything it receives.
00976 __forceinline static int extend_receive(int n)
00977 {
00978    unsigned int m = 1 << (n-1);
00979    unsigned int k;
00980    if (code_bits < n) grow_buffer_unsafe();
00981    k = (code_buffer >> (code_bits - n)) & bmask[n];
00982    code_bits -= n;
00983    // the following test is probably a random branch that won't
00984    // predict well. I tried to table accelerate it but failed.
00985    // maybe it's compiling as a conditional move?
00986    if (k < m)
00987       return (-1 << n) + k + 1;
00988    else
00989       return k;
00990 }
00991 
00992 // given a value that's at position X in the zigzag stream,
00993 // where does it appear in the 8x8 matrix coded as row-major?
00994 static uint8 dezigzag[64+15] =
00995 {
00996     0,  1,  8, 16,  9,  2,  3, 10,
00997    17, 24, 32, 25, 18, 11,  4,  5,
00998    12, 19, 26, 33, 40, 48, 41, 34,
00999    27, 20, 13,  6,  7, 14, 21, 28,
01000    35, 42, 49, 56, 57, 50, 43, 36,
01001    29, 22, 15, 23, 30, 37, 44, 51,
01002    58, 59, 52, 45, 38, 31, 39, 46,
01003    53, 60, 61, 54, 47, 55, 62, 63,
01004    // let corrupt input sample past end
01005    63, 63, 63, 63, 63, 63, 63, 63,
01006    63, 63, 63, 63, 63, 63, 63
01007 };
01008 
01009 // decode one 64-entry block--
01010 static int decode_block(short data[64], huffman *hdc, huffman *hac, int b)
01011 {
01012    int diff,dc,k;
01013    int t = decode(hdc);
01014    if (t < 0) return e("bad huffman code","Corrupt JPEG");
01015 
01016    // 0 all the ac values now so we can do it 32-bits at a time
01017    memset(data,0,64*sizeof(data[0]));
01018 
01019    diff = t ? extend_receive(t) : 0;
01020    dc = img_comp[b].dc_pred + diff;
01021    img_comp[b].dc_pred = dc;
01022    data[0] = (short) dc;
01023 
01024    // decode AC components, see JPEG spec
01025    k = 1;
01026    do {
01027       int r,s;
01028       int rs = decode(hac);
01029       if (rs < 0) return e("bad huffman code","Corrupt JPEG");
01030       s = rs & 15;
01031       r = rs >> 4;
01032       if (s == 0) {
01033          if (rs != 0xf0) break; // end block
01034          k += 16;
01035       } else {
01036          k += r;
01037          // decode into unzigzag'd location
01038          data[dezigzag[k++]] = (short) extend_receive(s);
01039       }
01040    } while (k < 64);
01041    return 1;
01042 }
01043 
01044 // take a -128..127 value and clamp it and convert to 0..255
01045 __forceinline static uint8 clamp(int x)
01046 {
01047    x += 128;
01048    // trick to use a single test to catch both cases
01049    if ((unsigned int) x > 255) {
01050       if (x < 0) return 0;
01051       if (x > 255) return 255;
01052    }
01053    return (uint8) x;
01054 }
01055 
01056 #define f2f(x)  (int) (((x) * 4096 + 0.5))
01057 #define fsh(x)  ((x) << 12)
01058 
01059 // derived from jidctint -- DCT_ISLOW
01060 #define IDCT_1D(s0,s1,s2,s3,s4,s5,s6,s7)       \
01061    int t0,t1,t2,t3,p1,p2,p3,p4,p5,x0,x1,x2,x3; \
01062    p2 = s2;                                    \
01063    p3 = s6;                                    \
01064    p1 = (p2+p3) * f2f(0.5411961f);             \
01065    t2 = p1 + p3*f2f(-1.847759065f);            \
01066    t3 = p1 + p2*f2f( 0.765366865f);            \
01067    p2 = s0;                                    \
01068    p3 = s4;                                    \
01069    t0 = fsh(p2+p3);                            \
01070    t1 = fsh(p2-p3);                            \
01071    x0 = t0+t3;                                 \
01072    x3 = t0-t3;                                 \
01073    x1 = t1+t2;                                 \
01074    x2 = t1-t2;                                 \
01075    t0 = s7;                                    \
01076    t1 = s5;                                    \
01077    t2 = s3;                                    \
01078    t3 = s1;                                    \
01079    p3 = t0+t2;                                 \
01080    p4 = t1+t3;                                 \
01081    p1 = t0+t3;                                 \
01082    p2 = t1+t2;                                 \
01083    p5 = (p3+p4)*f2f( 1.175875602f);            \
01084    t0 = t0*f2f( 0.298631336f);                 \
01085    t1 = t1*f2f( 2.053119869f);                 \
01086    t2 = t2*f2f( 3.072711026f);                 \
01087    t3 = t3*f2f( 1.501321110f);                 \
01088    p1 = p5 + p1*f2f(-0.899976223f);            \
01089    p2 = p5 + p2*f2f(-2.562915447f);            \
01090    p3 = p3*f2f(-1.961570560f);                 \
01091    p4 = p4*f2f(-0.390180644f);                 \
01092    t3 += p1+p4;                                \
01093    t2 += p2+p3;                                \
01094    t1 += p2+p4;                                \
01095    t0 += p1+p3;
01096 
01097 // .344 seconds on 3*anemones.jpg
01098 static void idct_block(uint8 *out, int out_stride, short data[64], uint8 *dequantize)
01099 {
01100    int i,val[64],*v=val;
01101    uint8 *o,*dq = dequantize;
01102    short *d = data;
01103 
01104    if (stbi_jpeg_dc_only) {
01105       // ok, I don't really know why this is right, but it seems to be:
01106       int z = 128 + ((d[0] * dq[0]) >> 3);
01107       for (i=0; i < 8; ++i) {
01108          out[0] = out[1] = out[2] = out[3] = out[4] = out[5] = out[6] = out[7] = z;
01109          out += out_stride;
01110       }
01111       return;
01112    }
01113 
01114    // columns
01115    for (i=0; i < 8; ++i,++d,++dq, ++v) {
01116       // if all zeroes, shortcut -- this avoids dequantizing 0s and IDCTing
01117       if (d[ 8]==0 && d[16]==0 && d[24]==0 && d[32]==0
01118            && d[40]==0 && d[48]==0 && d[56]==0) {
01119          //    no shortcut                 0     seconds
01120          //    (1|2|3|4|5|6|7)==0          0     seconds
01121          //    all separate               -0.047 seconds
01122          //    1 && 2|3 && 4|5 && 6|7:    -0.047 seconds
01123          int dcterm = d[0] * dq[0] << 2;
01124          v[0] = v[8] = v[16] = v[24] = v[32] = v[40] = v[48] = v[56] = dcterm;
01125       } else {
01126          IDCT_1D(d[ 0]*dq[ 0],d[ 8]*dq[ 8],d[16]*dq[16],d[24]*dq[24],
01127                  d[32]*dq[32],d[40]*dq[40],d[48]*dq[48],d[56]*dq[56])
01128          // constants scaled things up by 1<<12; let's bring them back
01129          // down, but keep 2 extra bits of precision
01130          x0 += 512; x1 += 512; x2 += 512; x3 += 512;
01131          v[ 0] = (x0+t3) >> 10;
01132          v[56] = (x0-t3) >> 10;
01133          v[ 8] = (x1+t2) >> 10;
01134          v[48] = (x1-t2) >> 10;
01135          v[16] = (x2+t1) >> 10;
01136          v[40] = (x2-t1) >> 10;
01137          v[24] = (x3+t0) >> 10;
01138          v[32] = (x3-t0) >> 10;
01139       }
01140    }
01141 
01142    for (i=0, v=val, o=out; i < 8; ++i,v+=8,o+=out_stride) {
01143       // no fast case since the first 1D IDCT spread components out
01144       IDCT_1D(v[0],v[1],v[2],v[3],v[4],v[5],v[6],v[7])
01145       // constants scaled things up by 1<<12, plus we had 1<<2 from first
01146       // loop, plus horizontal and vertical each scale by sqrt(8) so together
01147       // we've got an extra 1<<3, so 1<<17 total we need to remove.
01148       x0 += 65536; x1 += 65536; x2 += 65536; x3 += 65536;
01149       o[0] = clamp((x0+t3) >> 17);
01150       o[7] = clamp((x0-t3) >> 17);
01151       o[1] = clamp((x1+t2) >> 17);
01152       o[6] = clamp((x1-t2) >> 17);
01153       o[2] = clamp((x2+t1) >> 17);
01154       o[5] = clamp((x2-t1) >> 17);
01155       o[3] = clamp((x3+t0) >> 17);
01156       o[4] = clamp((x3-t0) >> 17);
01157    }
01158 }
01159 
01160 #define MARKER_none  0xff
01161 // if there's a pending marker from the entropy stream, return that
01162 // otherwise, fetch from the stream and get a marker. if there's no
01163 // marker, return 0xff, which is never a valid marker value
01164 static uint8 get_marker(void)
01165 {
01166    uint8 x;
01167    if (marker != MARKER_none) { x = marker; marker = MARKER_none; return x; }
01168    x = get8u();
01169    if (x != 0xff) return MARKER_none;
01170    while (x == 0xff)
01171       x = get8u();
01172    return x;
01173 }
01174 
01175 // in each scan, we'll have scan_n components, and the order
01176 // of the components is specified by order[]
01177 static int scan_n, order[4];
01178 static int restart_interval, todo;
01179 #define RESTART(x)     ((x) >= 0xd0 && (x) <= 0xd7)
01180 
01181 // after a restart interval, reset the entropy decoder and
01182 // the dc prediction
01183 static void reset(void)
01184 {
01185    code_bits = 0;
01186    code_buffer = 0;
01187    nomore = 0;
01188    img_comp[0].dc_pred = img_comp[1].dc_pred = img_comp[2].dc_pred = 0;
01189    marker = MARKER_none;
01190    todo = restart_interval ? restart_interval : 0x7fffffff;
01191    // no more than 1<<31 MCUs if no restart_interal? that's plenty safe,
01192    // since we don't even allow 1<<30 pixels
01193 }
01194 
01195 static int parse_entropy_coded_data(void)
01196 {
01197    reset();
01198    if (scan_n == 1) {
01199       int i,j;
01200       short data[64];
01201       int n = order[0];
01202       // non-interleaved data, we just need to process one block at a time,
01203       // in trivial scanline order
01204       // number of blocks to do just depends on how many actual "pixels" this
01205       // component has, independent of interleaved MCU blocking and such
01206       int w = (img_comp[n].x+7) >> 3;
01207       int h = (img_comp[n].y+7) >> 3;
01208       for (j=0; j < h; ++j) {
01209          for (i=0; i < w; ++i) {
01210             if (!decode_block(data, huff_dc+img_comp[n].hd, huff_ac+img_comp[n].ha, n)) return 0;
01211             idct_block(img_comp[n].data+img_comp[n].w2*j*8+i*8, img_comp[n].w2, data, dequant[img_comp[n].tq]);
01212             // every data block is an MCU, so countdown the restart interval
01213             if (--todo <= 0) {
01214                if (code_bits < 24) grow_buffer_unsafe();
01215                // if it's NOT a restart, then just bail, so we get corrupt data
01216                // rather than no data
01217                if (!RESTART(marker)) return 1;
01218                reset();
01219             }
01220          }
01221       }
01222    } else { // interleaved!
01223       int i,j,k,x,y;
01224       short data[64];
01225       for (j=0; j < img_mcu_y; ++j) {
01226          for (i=0; i < img_mcu_x; ++i) {
01227             // scan an interleaved mcu... process scan_n components in order
01228             for (k=0; k < scan_n; ++k) {
01229                int n = order[k];
01230                // scan out an mcu's worth of this component; that's just determined
01231                // by the basic H and V specified for the component
01232                for (y=0; y < img_comp[n].v; ++y) {
01233                   for (x=0; x < img_comp[n].h; ++x) {
01234                      int x2 = (i*img_comp[n].h + x)*8;
01235                      int y2 = (j*img_comp[n].v + y)*8;
01236                      if (!decode_block(data, huff_dc+img_comp[n].hd, huff_ac+img_comp[n].ha, n)) return 0;
01237                      idct_block(img_comp[n].data+img_comp[n].w2*y2+x2, img_comp[n].w2, data, dequant[img_comp[n].tq]);
01238                   }
01239                }
01240             }
01241             // after all interleaved components, that's an interleaved MCU,
01242             // so now count down the restart interval
01243             if (--todo <= 0) {
01244                if (code_bits < 24) grow_buffer_unsafe();
01245                // if it's NOT a restart, then just bail, so we get corrupt data
01246                // rather than no data
01247                if (!RESTART(marker)) return 1;
01248                reset();
01249             }
01250          }
01251       }
01252    }
01253    return 1;
01254 }
01255 
01256 static int process_marker(int m)
01257 {
01258    int L;
01259    switch (m) {
01260       case MARKER_none: // no marker found
01261          return e("expected marker","Corrupt JPEG");
01262 
01263       case 0xC2: // SOF - progressive
01264          return e("progressive jpeg","JPEG format not supported (progressive)");
01265 
01266       case 0xDD: // DRI - specify restart interval
01267          if (get16() != 4) return e("bad DRI len","Corrupt JPEG");
01268          restart_interval = get16();
01269          return 1;
01270 
01271       case 0xDB: // DQT - define quantization table
01272          L = get16()-2;
01273          while (L > 0) {
01274             int z = get8();
01275             int p = z >> 4;
01276             int t = z & 15,i;
01277             if (p != 0) return e("bad DQT type","Corrupt JPEG");
01278             if (t > 3) return e("bad DQT table","Corrupt JPEG");
01279             for (i=0; i < 64; ++i)
01280                dequant[t][dezigzag[i]] = get8u();
01281             L -= 65;
01282          }
01283          return L==0;
01284 
01285       case 0xC4: // DHT - define huffman table
01286          L = get16()-2;
01287          while (L > 0) {
01288             uint8 *v;
01289             int sizes[16],i,m=0;
01290             int z = get8();
01291             int tc = z >> 4;
01292             int th = z & 15;
01293             if (tc > 1 || th > 3) return e("bad DHT header","Corrupt JPEG");
01294             for (i=0; i < 16; ++i) {
01295                sizes[i] = get8();
01296                m += sizes[i];
01297             }
01298             L -= 17;
01299             if (tc == 0) {
01300                if (!build_huffman(huff_dc+th, sizes)) return 0;
01301                v = huff_dc[th].values;
01302             } else {
01303                if (!build_huffman(huff_ac+th, sizes)) return 0;
01304                v = huff_ac[th].values;
01305             }
01306             for (i=0; i < m; ++i)
01307                v[i] = get8u();
01308             L -= m;
01309          }
01310          return L==0;
01311    }
01312    // check for comment block or APP blocks
01313    if ((m >= 0xE0 && m <= 0xEF) || m == 0xFE) {
01314       skip(get16()-2);
01315       return 1;
01316    }
01317    return 0;
01318 }
01319 
01320 // after we see SOS
01321 static int process_scan_header(void)
01322 {
01323    int i;
01324    int Ls = get16();
01325    scan_n = get8();
01326    if (scan_n < 1 || scan_n > 4 || scan_n > (int) img_n) return e("bad SOS component count","Corrupt JPEG");
01327    if (Ls != 6+2*scan_n) return e("bad SOS len","Corrupt JPEG");
01328    for (i=0; i < scan_n; ++i) {
01329       int id = get8(), which;
01330       int z = get8();
01331       for (which = 0; which < img_n; ++which)
01332          if (img_comp[which].id == id)
01333             break;
01334       if (which == img_n) return 0;
01335       img_comp[which].hd = z >> 4;   if (img_comp[which].hd > 3) return e("bad DC huff","Corrupt JPEG");
01336       img_comp[which].ha = z & 15;   if (img_comp[which].ha > 3) return e("bad AC huff","Corrupt JPEG");
01337       order[i] = which;
01338    }
01339    if (get8() != 0) return e("bad SOS","Corrupt JPEG");
01340    get8(); // should be 63, but might be 0
01341    if (get8() != 0) return e("bad SOS","Corrupt JPEG");
01342 
01343    return 1;
01344 }
01345 
01346 static int process_frame_header(int scan)
01347 {
01348    int Lf,p,i,z, h_max=1,v_max=1;
01349    Lf = get16();         if (Lf < 11) return e("bad SOF len","Corrupt JPEG"); // JPEG
01350    p  = get8();          if (p != 8) return e("only 8-bit","JPEG format not supported: 8-bit only"); // JPEG baseline
01351    img_y = get16();      if (img_y == 0) return e("no header height", "JPEG format not supported: delayed height"); // Legal, but we don't handle it--but neither does IJG
01352    img_x = get16();      if (img_x == 0) return e("0 width","Corrupt JPEG"); // JPEG requires
01353    img_n = get8();
01354    if (img_n != 3 && img_n != 1) return e("bad component count","Corrupt JPEG");    // JFIF requires
01355 
01356    if (Lf != 8+3*img_n) return e("bad SOF len","Corrupt JPEG");
01357 
01358    for (i=0; i < img_n; ++i) {
01359       img_comp[i].id = get8();
01360       if (img_comp[i].id != i+1)   // JFIF requires
01361          if (img_comp[i].id != i)  // jpegtran outputs non-JFIF-compliant files!
01362             return e("bad component ID","Corrupt JPEG");
01363       z = get8();
01364       img_comp[i].h = (z >> 4);  if (!img_comp[i].h || img_comp[i].h > 4) return e("bad H","Corrupt JPEG");
01365       img_comp[i].v = z & 15;    if (!img_comp[i].v || img_comp[i].v > 4) return e("bad V","Corrupt JPEG");
01366       img_comp[i].tq = get8();   if (img_comp[i].tq > 3) return e("bad TQ","Corrupt JPEG");
01367    }
01368 
01369    if (scan != SCAN_load) return 1;
01370 
01371    if ((1 << 30) / img_x / img_n < img_y) return e("too large", "Image too large to decode");
01372 
01373    for (i=0; i < img_n; ++i) {
01374       if (img_comp[i].h > h_max) h_max = img_comp[i].h;
01375       if (img_comp[i].v > v_max) v_max = img_comp[i].v;
01376    }
01377 
01378    // compute interleaved mcu info
01379    img_h_max = h_max;
01380    img_v_max = v_max;
01381    img_mcu_w = h_max * 8;
01382    img_mcu_h = v_max * 8;
01383    img_mcu_x = (img_x + img_mcu_w-1) / img_mcu_w;
01384    img_mcu_y = (img_y + img_mcu_h-1) / img_mcu_h;
01385 
01386    for (i=0; i < img_n; ++i) {
01387       // number of effective pixels (e.g. for non-interleaved MCU)
01388       img_comp[i].x = (img_x * img_comp[i].h + h_max-1) / h_max;
01389       img_comp[i].y = (img_y * img_comp[i].v + v_max-1) / v_max;
01390       // to simplify generation, we'll allocate enough memory to decode
01391       // the bogus oversized data from using interleaved MCUs and their
01392       // big blocks (e.g. a 16x16 iMCU on an image of width 33); we won't
01393       // discard the extra data until colorspace conversion
01394       img_comp[i].w2 = img_mcu_x * img_comp[i].h * 8;
01395       img_comp[i].h2 = img_mcu_y * img_comp[i].v * 8;
01396       img_comp[i].data = (uint8 *) malloc(img_comp[i].w2 * img_comp[i].h2);
01397       if (img_comp[i].data == NULL) {
01398          for(--i; i >= 0; --i)
01399             free(img_comp[i].data);
01400          return e("outofmem", "Out of memory");
01401       }
01402    }
01403 
01404    return 1;
01405 }
01406 
01407 // use comparisons since in some cases we handle more than one case (e.g. SOF)
01408 #define DNL(x)         ((x) == 0xdc)
01409 #define SOI(x)         ((x) == 0xd8)
01410 #define EOI(x)         ((x) == 0xd9)
01411 #define SOF(x)         ((x) == 0xc0 || (x) == 0xc1)
01412 #define SOS(x)         ((x) == 0xda)
01413 
01414 static int decode_jpeg_header(int scan)
01415 {
01416    int m;
01417    marker = MARKER_none; // initialize cached marker to empty
01418    m = get_marker();
01419    if (!SOI(m)) return e("no SOI","Corrupt JPEG");
01420    if (scan == SCAN_type) return 1;
01421    m = get_marker();
01422    while (!SOF(m)) {
01423       if (!process_marker(m)) return 0;
01424       m = get_marker();
01425       while (m == MARKER_none) {
01426          // some files have extra padding after their blocks, so ok, we'll scan
01427          if (at_eof()) return e("no SOF", "Corrupt JPEG");
01428          m = get_marker();
01429       }
01430    }
01431    if (!process_frame_header(scan)) return 0;
01432    return 1;
01433 }
01434 
01435 static int decode_jpeg_image(void)
01436 {
01437    int m;
01438    restart_interval = 0;
01439    if (!decode_jpeg_header(SCAN_load)) return 0;
01440    m = get_marker();
01441    while (!EOI(m)) {
01442       if (SOS(m)) {
01443          if (!process_scan_header()) return 0;
01444          if (!parse_entropy_coded_data()) return 0;
01445       } else {
01446          if (!process_marker(m)) return 0;
01447       }
01448       m = get_marker();
01449    }
01450    return 1;
01451 }
01452 
01453 // static jfif-centered resampling with cross-block smoothing
01454 // here by cross-block smoothing what I mean is that the resampling
01455 // is bilerp and crosses blocks; I dunno what IJG means
01456 
01457 #define div4(x) ((uint8) ((x) >> 2))
01458 
01459 static void resample_v_2(uint8 *out1, uint8 *input, int w, int h, int s)
01460 {
01461    // need to generate two samples vertically for every one in input
01462    uint8 *above;
01463    uint8 *below;
01464    uint8 *source;
01465    uint8 *out2;
01466    int i,j;
01467    source = input;
01468    out2 = out1+w;
01469    for (j=0; j < h; ++j) {
01470       above = source;
01471       source = input + j*s;
01472       below = source + s; if (j == h-1) below = source;
01473       for (i=0; i < w; ++i) {
01474          int n = source[i]*3;
01475          out1[i] = div4(above[i] + n);
01476          out2[i] = div4(below[i] + n);
01477       }
01478       out1 += w*2;
01479       out2 += w*2;
01480    }
01481 }
01482 
01483 static void resample_h_2(uint8 *out, uint8 *input, int w, int h, int s)
01484 {
01485    // need to generate two samples horizontally for every one in input
01486    int i,j;
01487    if (w == 1) {
01488       for (j=0; j < h; ++j)
01489          out[j*2+0] = out[j*2+1] = input[j*s];
01490       return;
01491    }
01492    for (j=0; j < h; ++j) {
01493       out[0] = input[0];
01494       out[1] = div4(input[0]*3 + input[1]);
01495       for (i=1; i < w-1; ++i) {
01496          int n = input[i]*3;
01497          out[i*2-2] = div4(input[i-1] + n);
01498          out[i*2-1] = div4(input[i+1] + n);
01499       }
01500       out[w*2-2] = div4(input[w-2]*3 + input[w-1]);
01501       out[w*2-1] = input[w-1];
01502       out += w*2;
01503       input += s;
01504    }
01505 }
01506 
01507 // .172 seconds on 3*anemones.jpg
01508 static void resample_hv_2(uint8 *out, uint8 *input, int w, int h, int s)
01509 {
01510    // need to generate 2x2 samples for every one in input
01511    int i,j;
01512    int os = w*2;
01513    // generate edge samples... @TODO lerp them!
01514    for (i=0; i < w; ++i) {
01515       out[i*2+0] = out[i*2+1] = input[i];
01516       out[i*2+(2*h-1)*os+0] = out[i*2+(2*h-1)*os+1] = input[i+(h-1)*w];
01517    }
01518    for (j=0; j < h; ++j) {
01519       out[j*os*2+0] = out[j*os*2+os+0] = input[j*w];
01520       out[j*os*2+os-1] = out[j*os*2+os+os-1] = input[j*w+i-1];
01521    }
01522    // now generate interior samples; i & j point to top left of input
01523    for (j=0; j < h-1; ++j) {
01524       uint8 *in1 = input+j*s;
01525       uint8 *in2 = in1 + s;
01526       uint8 *out1 = out + (j*2+1)*os + 1;
01527       uint8 *out2 = out1 + os;
01528       for (i=0; i < w-1; ++i) {
01529          int p00 = in1[0], p01=in1[1], p10=in2[0], p11=in2[1];
01530          int p00_3 = p00*3, p01_3 = p01*3, p10_3 = p10*3, p11_3 = p11*3;
01531 
01532          #define div16(x)  ((uint8) ((x) >> 4))
01533 
01534          out1[0] = div16(p00*9 + p01_3 + p10_3 + p11);
01535          out1[1] = div16(p01*9 + p00_3 + p01_3 + p10);
01536          out2[0] = div16(p10*9 + p11_3 + p00_3 + p01);
01537          out2[1] = div16(p11*9 + p10_3 + p01_3 + p00);
01538          out1 += 2;
01539          out2 += 2;                                                         
01540          ++in1;
01541          ++in2;
01542       }
01543    }
01544 }
01545 
01546 #define float2fixed(x)  ((int) ((x) * 65536 + 0.5))
01547 
01548 // 0.38 seconds on 3*anemones.jpg   (0.25 with processor = Pro)
01549 // VC6 without processor=Pro is generating multiple LEAs per multiply!
01550 static void YCbCr_to_RGB_row(uint8 *out, uint8 *y, uint8 *pcb, uint8 *pcr, int count, int step)
01551 {
01552    int i;
01553    for (i=0; i < count; ++i) {
01554       int y_fixed = (y[i] << 16) + 32768; // rounding
01555       int r,g,b;
01556       int cr = pcr[i] - 128;
01557       int cb = pcb[i] - 128;
01558       r = y_fixed + cr*float2fixed(1.40200f);
01559       g = y_fixed - cr*float2fixed(0.71414f) - cb*float2fixed(0.34414f);
01560       b = y_fixed                            + cb*float2fixed(1.77200f);
01561       r >>= 16;
01562       g >>= 16;
01563       b >>= 16;
01564       if ((unsigned) r > 255) { if (r < 0) r = 0; else r = 255; }
01565       if ((unsigned) g > 255) { if (g < 0) g = 0; else g = 255; }
01566       if ((unsigned) b > 255) { if (b < 0) b = 0; else b = 255; }
01567       out[0] = (uint8)r;
01568       out[1] = (uint8)g;
01569       out[2] = (uint8)b;
01570       if (step == 4) out[3] = 255;
01571       out += step;
01572    }
01573 }
01574 
01575 // clean up the temporary component buffers
01576 static void cleanup_jpeg(void)
01577 {
01578    int i;
01579    for (i=0; i < img_n; ++i) {
01580       if (img_comp[i].data) {
01581          free(img_comp[i].data);
01582          img_comp[i].data = NULL;
01583       }
01584    }
01585 }
01586 
01587 static uint8 *load_jpeg_image(int *out_x, int *out_y, int *comp, int req_comp)
01588 {
01589    int i, n;
01590    // validate req_comp
01591    if (req_comp < 0 || req_comp > 4) return epuc("bad req_comp", "Internal error");
01592 
01593    // load a jpeg image from whichever source
01594    if (!decode_jpeg_image()) { cleanup_jpeg(); return NULL; }
01595 
01596    // determine actual number of components to generate
01597    n = req_comp ? req_comp : img_n;
01598 
01599    // resample components to full size... memory wasteful, but this
01600    // lets us bilerp across blocks while upsampling
01601    for (i=0; i < img_n; ++i) {
01602       // if we're outputting fewer than 3 components, we're grey not RGB;
01603       // in that case, don't bother upsampling Cb or Cr
01604       if (n < 3 && i) continue;
01605 
01606       // check if the component scale is less than max; if so it needs upsampling
01607       if (img_comp[i].h != img_h_max || img_comp[i].v != img_v_max) {
01608          int stride = img_x;
01609          // allocate final size; make sure it's big enough for upsampling off
01610          // the edges with upsample up to 4x4 (although we only support 2x2
01611          // currently)
01612          uint8 *new_data = (uint8 *) malloc((img_x+3)*(img_y+3));
01613          if (new_data == NULL) {
01614             cleanup_jpeg();
01615             return epuc("outofmem", "Out of memory (image too large?)");
01616          }
01617          if (img_comp[i].h*2 == img_h_max && img_comp[i].v*2 == img_v_max) {
01618             int tx = (img_x+1)>>1;
01619             resample_hv_2(new_data, img_comp[i].data, tx,(img_y+1)>>1, img_comp[i].w2);
01620             stride = tx*2;
01621          } else if (img_comp[i].h == img_h_max && img_comp[i].v*2 == img_v_max) {
01622             resample_v_2(new_data, img_comp[i].data, img_x,(img_y+1)>>1, img_comp[i].w2);
01623          } else if (img_comp[i].h*2 == img_h_max && img_comp[i].v == img_v_max) {
01624             int tx = (img_x+1)>>1;
01625             resample_h_2(new_data, img_comp[i].data, tx,img_y, img_comp[i].w2);
01626             stride = tx*2;
01627          } else {
01628             // @TODO resample uncommon sampling pattern with nearest neighbor
01629             free(new_data);
01630             cleanup_jpeg();
01631             return epuc("uncommon H or V", "JPEG not supported: atypical downsampling mode");
01632          }
01633          img_comp[i].w2 = stride;
01634          free(img_comp[i].data);
01635          img_comp[i].data = new_data;
01636       }
01637    }
01638 
01639    // now convert components to output image
01640    {
01641       uint32 i,j;
01642       uint8 *output = (uint8 *) malloc(n * img_x * img_y + 1);
01643       if (n >= 3) { // output STBI_rgb_*
01644          for (j=0; j < img_y; ++j) {
01645             uint8 *y  = img_comp[0].data + j*img_comp[0].w2;
01646             uint8 *out = output + n * img_x * j;
01647             if (img_n == 3) {
01648                uint8 *cb = img_comp[1].data + j*img_comp[1].w2;
01649                uint8 *cr = img_comp[2].data + j*img_comp[2].w2;
01650                YCbCr_to_RGB_row(out, y, cb, cr, img_x, n);
01651             } else {
01652                for (i=0; i < img_x; ++i) {
01653                   out[0] = out[1] = out[2] = y[i];
01654                   out[3] = 255; // not used if n == 3
01655                   out += n;
01656                }
01657             }
01658          }
01659       } else {      // output STBI_grey_*
01660          for (j=0; j < img_y; ++j) {
01661             uint8 *y  = img_comp[0].data + j*img_comp[0].w2;
01662             uint8 *out = output + n * img_x * j;
01663             if (n == 1)
01664                for (i=0; i < img_x; ++i) *out++ = *y++;
01665             else
01666                for (i=0; i < img_x; ++i) *out++ = *y++, *out++ = 255;
01667          }
01668       }
01669       cleanup_jpeg();
01670       *out_x = img_x;
01671       *out_y = img_y;
01672       if (comp) *comp  = img_n; // report original components, not output
01673       return output;
01674    }
01675 }
01676

01680    start_file(f);
01681    return load_jpeg_image(x,y,comp,req_comp);
01682 }
01683

01688    if (!f) return NULL;

01690    fclose(f);
01691    return data;
01692 }
01693 #endif

01719 // @TODO:
01720 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
01721 extern int      stbi_jpeg_info            (char *filename,           int *x, int *y, int *comp);
01722 extern int      stbi_jpeg_info_from_file  (FILE *f,                  int *x, int *y, int *comp);
